articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on the 63rd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message said the Korean people are pleased that the Cambodian people are achieving great successes in defending the sovereignty of the country and making development under the leadership of the king. 
					
					 It sincerely wished the king good health and happiness, believing the historical and traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Cambodia would grow stronger.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Cambodian PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Cambodian PM
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Hun Sen, prime minister of Cambodia, on Tuesday on the 63rd anniversary of its independence.
					 In the belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the Cambodian prime minister great success in his work for the development and stability of the country.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong H sent a similar message to Prak Sokhon, minister of State and minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia, on the same day.

articles.title: Women's Union Members Present Artillery Pieces "Women's Union" to KPA
articles.content:
Women's Union Members Present Artillery Pieces "Women's Union" to KPA
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) presented the Korean People's Army (KPA) with artillery pieces "Women's Union" on the 6th Congress of the DWUK.
					 The artillery pieces reflect the patriotic will of the women's union members throughout the country to make a contribution, small as it may be, to bolstering up the country's defence capability.
					
					 The presentation ceremony was held at the plaza in front of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum on Nov. 8.
					
					 It was attended by Choe Ryong Hae, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and the women's union, officials concerned, service members and women's union members.
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the women's union, said in her presentation address that it was a proud tradition of Songun Korea to positively support the KPA, adding that the artillery pieces reflect the firm faith of the Korean women to steadfastly carry out the revolutionary cause of Songun started in Mt. Paektu under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 She appealed to the women's union members to love the service personnel like their own flesh and blood and sincerely support them and make a positive contribution to increasing the combat capacity of the KPA.
					
					 The presentation certificate was handed to an official of the ministry.
					
					 Then speeches were made.

articles.title: 20th National Exhibition of Sports Scientific and Technological Achievements Opens
articles.content:
20th National Exhibition of Sports Scientific and Technological Achievements Open
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The 20th national exhibition of sports scientific and technological achievements was opened with due ceremony at the Sci-Tech Complex on Tuesday.
					 Displayed there were more than 1,400 scientific and technological achievements including software, measuring appliances, sports apparatuses, books and papers presented by the fields of sports, education, science and technology and industrial establishments.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission; Ri Chung Gil, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission; Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission; Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences; Kim Jang San, first vice-chairman of the Football Federation; officials in the sports field, and working people of the participating units.  
					
					 The exhibition will last till November 14.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State Emergency Disaster Committee led by Chairman Kang Il Sop came back home here Tuesday after taking part in the Asian Ministerial Conference for Disaster Risk Reduction held in New Delhi.

articles.title: Results of Housing Construction in Disaster Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Results of Housing Construction in Disaster Areas of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the DPRK are speeding up the housing construction in the flood-hit northern part of the country.
					 In 40-odd days they completed the construction of 1,803 homes in Obong-ri, Yuson district and Ingye-ri of Hoeryong City and 504 homes in the township and Namjak-ri of Yonsa County.
					
					 Meanwhile, soldier-builders carried out the construction of 1,486 homes in Musan County, including 50 five-storied apartment houses and 169 single-storied houses.

articles.title: Historical Sites and Relics Restored in Kaesong City of DPRK
articles.content:
Historical Sites and Relics Restored in Kaesong City of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Citizens in Kaesong City of the DPRK have paid big efforts to restoring the historical sites and relics in the city to their original state.
					 In the city, which was the capital of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392), there are more than 110 historical sites and relics.
					
					 The citizens repaired in the principle of historicism scores of historical sites and relics, including the monument to the Sonjuk Bridge, Phyochung Monuments, Manwoltae, Mausoleum of King Kyonghyo and Sungyang Confucian Shrine. They also reconstructed the Kaesong Walls and the walls in Mt. Taehung.
					
					 In particular, they successfully restored a temple for King Wang Kon's Mausoleum and a shrine at Koryo Songgyungwan Academy.

articles.title: New Strains of High-yield Crops Cultivated in DPRK
articles.content:
New Strains of High-yield Crops Cultivated in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Academy of Agricultural Science in the DPRK has recently bred new strains of high-yield crops suitable to alpine regions in the northern part of the country.
					 The new crop strains include potato, spring wheat, corn and beans. Those potato and wheat strains, to be cultivated in the region of 1000-1400 meters above sea level, are resistant to germs and their yield per hectare is considerably high.
					
					 The researchers also established a technique for cultivating corn and bean in the alpine region.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. Attempt to Create NATO of Asian Version
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. Attempt to Create NATO of Asian Version 
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is now working in real earnest to expand its military bloc for carrying out its strategy for world domination.
					 The U.S. deputy secretary of Defense and the Japanese deputy minister of Defence for administrative affairs were recently closeted in Washington over the joint actions to be taken to cope with what they called "potential threat." Against this backdrop the U.S. is massively beefing up its forces in south Korea and its vicinity. 
					
					 The U.S. has already begun deploying 3 500-strong 1st armored combat brigade in south Korea on a rotation basis and informed the Japanese authorities of its plan for deploying 16 F-35 stealth fighters in a base of the U.S. Marines in Japan from next year.
					
					 It also announced that it would deploy in Japan, etc. the U.S. forces' biggest new type Zumwalt class destroyer and Wasp class large amphibious craft carrying new type fighters and the expeditionary force of the 31st Marines of the U.S. imperialists to be hurled before any other force in contingency on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 This is part of the dangerous scenario to form the U.S.-led NATO of Asian version led by the U.S. 
					
					 The above-said strategy is aimed at maintaining the Cold War structure to contain big powers in the region by relying on the "security" alliance involving Japan, south Korea, etc.
					
					 The U.S. has used the system of the US-Japan-south Korea military alliance as a strategic lever for increasing its influence over Northeast Asia and containing the DPRK, China and Russia.
					
					 The alliance is designed to pressurize the Asian region by tightening its aggressive nexus through the speedy movement of its forces stationed in the region.
					
					 The U.S. is mulling making the alliance perform the same function as that of NATO in a bid to use it as a means for carrying out the strategy for dominating the Asia-Pacific region including Northeast Asia.
					
					 The U.S. has used such alliance as a shock brigade for carrying out its Asia-Pacific strategy, describing it as "cornerstone" and "key axis" for implementing the strategy, whenever an opportunity presented itself.
					
					 At present, the tripartite military "cooperation" is being further tightened according to the second-phase process of "Asia-Pacific rebalancing strategy."
					
					 There took place in the U.S. on Oct. 14 a meeting of the chairmen of chiefs of joint staff of the U.S., Japanese and south Korean forces at which they committed themselves to providing "extended deterrence" by involving forces of all services and arms including conventional and nuclear and missile capabilities.
					
					 The U.S. staged a missile warning drill in the waters off Hawaii together with Japan and south Korean puppet forces for the first time in history. Recently they carried out a joint naval maneuver in the high seas east of Jeju Island.
					
					 The moves to knock into shape NATO of Asian version with the above-said triangular alliance as its parent body are becoming a reality. This is spurring a new arms race in Northeast Asia including the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is crystal clear that the creation of a new military bloc by the U.S. in Northeast Asia would reduce the whole of Asia into a theatre of military confrontation.
					
					 The reality clearly proves once again that it is the U.S. and its strategy for military domination that pose a threat to the peace and security in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 A military bloc is a product of the Cold War.
					
					 The creation of a new military bloc diametrically runs counter to the trend of the times.
					
					 The U.S. moves to maintain a new Cold War structure and create NATO of Asian version in Northeast Asia will inevitably spark off strong opposition of the neighboring countries.

articles.title: Ulterior Aim Sought by Japan through Agreement on Protecting Military Intelligence with S. Korea Disclosed
articles.content:
Ulterior Aim Sought by Japan through Agreement on Protecting Military Intelligence with S. Korea Disclosed
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Japan's Defense Minister Inada at a recent press conference expressed the intention for hastening the talks for concluding an agreement on protecting military intelligence with south Korea within this year so that Japan and south Korea may share secret information in the field of security.
					 He said "the situation surrounding north Korea became very serious and Japan-south Korea cooperation is very important to cope with north Korea's nuclear and missile issue." He added that "he would negotiate with the south Korean side with the goal of earlier conclusion of the agreement."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary:
					
					 This reveals the sinister attempt to invade the DPRK at any cost in collusion with south Korea, backed by the U.S. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries calculate that they can tighten the military nexus with south Korea under the pretext that the north may provoke the south, taking advantage of the chaos caused by the fierce anti-Park Geun Hye struggle.
					
					 However, the Japanese reactionaries have made one miscalculation. 
					
					 That is their calculation may add fuel to the flames in south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean people will never remain a passive onlooker to the fact that the group of Park Geun Hye, wicked pro-U.S., pro-Japanese lackey, is threatening the destiny of the nation by selling its dignity and interests and paving the Japanese reactionaries' way of reinvasion, preoccupied with sycophancy and dependence on foreign forces. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are working hard to turn south Korea into a military springboard for invading the Asian continent by using Park Geun Hye more dead than alive with the backing of the U.S. But, this will get them nowhere.
					
					 They would be well advised to behave themselves, stopping their foolish acts of inviting disasters.

articles.title: Minju Joson Flays Japan's Criminal Distortion of History
articles.content:
Minju Joson Flays Japan's Criminal Distortion of History
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The complete map of the Empire of Japan and the map for the course of the secondary education, a Japanese textbook, published by the Geological Survey Office of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce of Japan in 1888 and 1892, were opened to the public.
					 Those maps prove that Tok Islets have been part of the Korean territory historically.
					
					 The islets are marked outside the boundary of Japan on the Asian map in the textbook written by Yamagami who is a renowned geologist of Japan and an author of the geography textbook.
					
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says: 
					
					 It is preposterous for Japan to raise a claim to the islets though they are part of the territory of Korea. This is an intolerable challenge to the sovereignty of the Korean nation and sheer distortion of history.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are making no scruple of tampering with history, bereft of even an iota of conscience and sense of moral obligation, in a criminal bid to dominate Asia.
					
					 It is the black-hearted intention of Japan to create conditions favorable for realizing its ambition for militarist overseas aggression by distorting history to meet the requirements of Japan.
					
					 The world is now well aware of what Japan seeks and desires.
					
					 No matter what rhetoric Japan may let out to justify its behavior, it will only bring its ugly colors to light. It is the top priority task of Japan to redress its past crimes and have a proper view on history.
					
					 It can take a right road for future only when it draws a lesson with history as a mirror.
					
					 Japan had better bear in mind that the distortion of history is not a way out and change its twisted mind as quickly as possible.

articles.title: Funerals for Paek Nam Gi Held in Seoul
articles.content:
Funerals for Paek Nam Gi Held in Seoul
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Funerals for peasant Paek Nam Gi who was ruthlessly killed by the barbarous suppression by the fascist police took place in south Korea on Nov. 5 and 6, according to reports from Seoul.
					 The funeral could not be held due to the Park Geun Hye group of traitors' coercive attempt to make an autopsy of the deceased in a bid to cover up the truth about the murder and evade the blame for it. But it was held 41 days later thanks to the staunch actions of people from all walks of life including the bereaved family members and the Headquarters of Struggle for Paek Nam Gi.
					
					 Present at the funeral were bereaved families, members of the Headquarters of Struggle for Paek Nam Gi, lawmakers from opposition parties and other political figures and people from all walks of life in south Korea.
					
					 The coffin was carried out of the hospital of Seoul National University in the morning of Nov. 5.
					
					 A memorial service took place at the Myongdong Cathedral. The funeral procession marched towards the crossroads to the entrance of the Jongro District Office where Paek fell down due to the police suppression.
					
					 Many citizens honored the memory of the deceased who devoted his soul to the struggle for democratization and independence of the south Korean society.
					
					 A farewell ceremony took place at the Kwanghwamun plaza outside Chongwadae on that afternoon with more than 10 000 citizens including the mayor of Seoul City, lawmakers from opposition parties and political figures.
					
					 Speakers expressed their will to continue struggle to punish the murderous regime.
					
					 Meanwhile, open-air funerals were held in Posong where Paek was born and other places on Nov. 6 and then the body of the deceased was buried at the Mangwol-dong cemetery.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter to Those Attending Seventh Congress of GFTUK Posted on Spanish Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter to Those Attending Seventh Congress of GFTUK Posted on Spanish Website
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Spanish Vasco Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on Nov. 2 posted on its website "The Duty of the Working Class of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the Times and the Tasks Facing Trade Union Organizations", a letter sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un to those attending the Seventh Congress of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK), on October 25, Juche 105 (2016).
					 The letter indicates the tasks and ways for the heroic working class of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to become the engine propelling the masses forward on the general onward march and the example for all other members of society to follow in stepping up the building of a powerful socialist country, holding aloft the banner of modelling the whole society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Germany
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Germany on November 2.
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to set the remembrance period from Nov. 2 to December 17 and significantly organize political and cultural events including seminar, meeting and reading session praising the immortal life and feats of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Prague on November 1.
					 Jozef Servista, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party and vice-chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.  
					
					 The committee decided to widely organize political and cultural events praising the immortal revolutionary life and feats of Kim Jong Il on the fifth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Norodom Sihamoni
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Norodom Sihamoni
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 8 un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Cambodia, Norodom Sihamoni, con motivo del 63o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					En la misiva, el remitente senalo que el pueblo coreano se alegra de que el pueblo camboyano logre grandes exitos en el trabajo para defender la soberania y lograr el desarrollo del pais bajo la direccion del destinatario.
					
					Expresando la conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas en lo adelante las relaciones historicas y tradicionales de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Camboya, formulo votos sinceros por la salud y la felicidad del destinatario.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju felicita 63o aniversario de la independencia de Camboya
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju felicita 63o aniversario de la independencia de Camboya 
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, envio el dia 8 un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo camboyano, Hun Sen, con motivo del 63o aniversario de la independencia de este reino. 
					El remitente expreso la conviccion de que las historicas y tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises seguiran desarrollandose favorablemente en el futuro y deseo mayores exitos en los trabajos del destinatario por el desarrollo y la estabilidad del pais.
					
					El mismo dia, el canciller coreano Ri Yong Ho emitio el mensaje de felicitacion a Prak Sokhon, ministro de Estado, Asuntos Exteriores y Cooperacion Internacional de Camboya.

articles.title: Levantadas viviendas en ciudad de Hoeryong y distritos de Yonsa y Musan
articles.content:
Levantadas viviendas en ciudad de Hoeryong y distritos de Yonsa y Musan
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Los constructores militares edificaron con exito durante 40 dias y pico mil 803 viviendas en las comunas de Obong y Ingye, la zona de Yuson y otros lugares de la ciudad de Hoeryong y 504 en la cabecera distrital y la comuna de Namjak del distrito de Yonsa.
					Por otra parte, los uniformados enviados al distrito de Musan terminaron la construccion de mil 486 viviendas incluso 50 apartamentos de 5 pisos y 169 viviendas de un piso.
					
					Con la decision de ofrecer cuanto antes nuevas viviendas a los evacuados por las inundaciones, los constructores militares mostraron sin reserva en las obras el modo de trabajo del ejercito del pueblo, asi que renovaron las zonas como las aldeas pintorescas socialistas.
